pages.text: A mutation of undersea kelp and a vivid, flowering plant, this herb's attunement to the water cannot be denied.$(br2)The flowers, when picked, are perpetually damp, and when squeezed can produce a sweet liquid.$(br2)Formerly planted in flooded fields or even under the water itself, it is a $(l:herbs/dewgonia#renew)renewable resource$().

pages.title: Renewability
pages.text: With the discovery of $(l:resources/elemental_soil)elemental soil$(), the need for flooded fields and underwater plantations disappeared.$(br2)It can be planted on any of the five types of elemental soil, and element matching is not required.$(br2)When ready to harvest, dripping clusters of flowers growing on firm stems will give off the sweet scent of the ocean.
